intro: Luzula erecta proles pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean wood sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small and clustered in spike-like inflorescences, contributing to its ecological importance in mountain ecosystems.
